translation.en: ♪ Hey ♪
♪ It seems like everywhere I go ♪ ♪ The more I see, the less I know ♪
[Alan] You know, this Lamaze class got me concerned.
translation.es: Esta clase de Lamaze me preocupó.

translation.en: Is there really a chance that you're gonna stop breathin' while givin' birth?
translation.es: ¿Es posible dejar de respirar durante el parto?

translation.en: -What? -Like everything is going great,
translation.es: Todo va bien y digo: "Uno, dos, tres",

translation.en: and I'm like, "One, two, three," and your face turns blue,
translation.es: Todo va bien y digo: "Uno, dos, tres", y tu cara se pone azul,

translation.en: and you stop breathing, I'm like, "Breathe! Breathe!" [laughs]
translation.es: y dejas de respirar, y yo grito: "¡Respira!".

translation.en: Alan, it's about us being ready.
It's about us doing this together.
Well, you know, girl, doing this together is what got us here in the first place.
translation.es: Hacerlo juntos es lo que nos llevó a este momento.

translation.en: Except your breathing was more like, "Oh, Alan!
translation.es: Pero tu respiración era más... - "¡Es increíble! - ¡Alan!

translation.en: -Oh, it's amazing!" -Alan.
-"Oh, Alan, it's so big!" -Alan!
-"It's so big!" -Stop it! You're being ridiculous!
Oh, I gotta get back to work. It's the last day before maternity leave.
translation.es: Debo ir a trabajar. Es mi último día.

translation.en: -I'm gonna miss work. -Yeah, I wish I could say the same.
translation.es: Extrañaré trabajar. Ojalá pudiera decir eso. Linda está enojada.

translation.en: -Linda's on a warpath. -Oh.
translation.es: Ojalá pudiera decir eso. Linda está enojada.

translation.en: Apparently, Doug pitched a new holiday e-card, and it didn't go so well.
translation.es: Doug presentó la nueva tarjeta de vacaciones y no le fue bien.

translation.en: Babe, who's gonna send an e-card
for someone graduating from rehab for the second time?
translation.es: a alguien que sale de rehabilitación por segunda vez?

translation.en: Well, it was a lot better than "Happy Hoe-loween". You know, for women that wear slutty costumes.
translation.es: Era mejor que la de "Feliz Puta-ween" para las que se disfrazan de zorras.

translation.en: Or what about "White Kwanzaa," which makes absolutely no sense at all.
translation.es: ¿Qué hay de "Kwanzaa Blanco", que no tiene sentido?

translation.en: And don't forget to tell Linda you're taking paternity leave.
translation.es: Dile a Linda de tu licencia por paternidad.

translation.en: I know. Listen, nothing's more important to me than my family,
translation.es: Sí. Nada es más importante que mi familia, ni siquiera ser socio en la compañía

translation.en: not even a partnership
translation.es: ni siquiera ser socio en la compañía

translation.en: at the company I've been busting my ass for all these years.
translation.es: en la que he trabajado duro por años.

translation.en: You think maybe I should've just slept my way to the top?
Okay, babe. I'll see you later.
Don't think Linda want it? You see the way Linda looks at your boy!
translation.es: ¿No crees que Linda lo quiere? - ¿Viste cómo me mira? - No me interesa.

translation.en: -Not interested in that conversation. -Don't be jealous.
translation.es: - ¿Viste cómo me mira? - No me interesa. No te pongas celosa.

translation.en: -I love you. -[Marie] Love you, too.
Bye.
Linda, I wanna apologize for the pitch.
You know, I've been delegating more to the team, and I want...
translation.es: He estado delegando más en el equipo...

translation.en: Y-You know, 'cause the baby's due soon--
I know you got a lot on your plate, Alan.
I won't pretend to understand, I never wanted babies. Ick!
translation.es: No pretenderé entenderte, nunca quise un bebé.

translation.en: [stammers] You know, um...
I-I-I don't usually drink at work.
translation.es: No suelo beber en el trabajo.

translation.en: -[slurps] -Oh, damn.
Alan. There was a time when you took charge.
translation.es: Alan, hubo un tiempo en el que tomabas el mando.

translation.en: You were aggressive. You dressed the part.
You were becoming the face of this company, literally!
translation.es: Te estabas convirtiendo en la cara de la compañía.

translation.en: Now... everything's about...
translation.es: Ahora todo es sobre el bebé.

translation.en: Linda, that's what I wanted to talk to you about.
[stammers] I'm gonna be taking some time off.
-What? -Just a month or so.
It's like paternity leave.
[Linda] Paternity leave?!
You're in line for a partnership.
translation.es: Estás en camino a ser socio.

translation.en: Do you really think, Alan, this is the right time to vacay?
translation.es: ¿Crees que es el mejor momento para unas vacaciones?

translation.en: It's not a vacay. I just want to be there for my family.
translation.es: No son vacaciones. Quiero estar con mi familia.

translation.en: And you know what? That partnership, I earned it.
Now, I have a baby appointment, and I promised Marie I'd be there.
translation.es: Tengo una cita con el médico, y le prometí a Marie que iría.

translation.en: [Linda] Fine!
[mocking] Go to your little appointment with your sonogram and your gel.
translation.es: Ve a tu cita con tu ecografía y tu gel.

translation.en: [Dr. Greenberg] Everything looks great.
Right where you'd expect to be at 35 weeks.
translation.es: Como debería ser a las 35 semanas.

translation.en: -[Marie chuckles] -Thank you. Lights, please.
Now, because of your advanced maternal age--
Uh, I'm only 35.
-And 35 is really 15 in Black-people age. -Mm-hmm.
translation.es: Y 35 es como 15 en los negros.

translation.en: You know that black don't crack...
[both] ...unless you smoke it. Okay?
Sure, but 35 is still considered an elevated risk pregnancy.
translation.es: Claro, pero 35 aún se considera un embarazo de alto riesgo.

translation.en: -Uh, no pre-eclampsia in your family? -No.
-No food allergies? No history of cancer? -No.
No, she has A-plus genes.
You know, her daddy's a federal judge.
translation.es: Su padre es un juez federal.

translation.en: She graduated top of her class at Columbia Law,
translation.es: Fue la mejor de su clase en Columbia

translation.en: and she's the first female partner in her firm.
translation.es: y la primera mujer en ser socia en su firma.

translation.en: Hey, Doc... I trapped her.
translation.es: Doc, yo la atrapé a ella.

translation.en: -Uh, one more thing... -[Marie] Hmm?
Alan... we don't have your family history.
translation.es: Alan, no tenemos tu historial familiar.

translation.en: Oh, well, there's a perfectly good explanation for that. I don't have one.
translation.es: Hay una buena explicación para eso. No tengo.

translation.en: See, I was put up for adoption, and I was raised in foster homes.
translation.es: Me dieron en adopción y me crié en hogares de acogida.

translation.en: I moved around a lot. I never really met my birth mother.
translation.es: Me mudé mucho. No conozco a mi madre.

translation.en: Hence, no family medical history.
translation.es: Por eso, no tengo historial médico.

translation.en: [Marie] But...
he checked out great after his last physical.
translation.es: Su último chequeo médico fue genial.

translation.en: That's right. You are lookin' at one perfect human specimen.
translation.es: Así es. Estás viendo un ejemplar humano perfecto.

translation.en: Now, what more could you ask for?
Girl!
-Look at that! -[Marie laughs]
-Little baby gonna come out buff. [grunts] -[growls]
translation.es: Este bebé va a salir con músculos.

translation.en: [Alan] Why can't they just put it in the chart,
translation.es: ¿Por qué no lo ponen en la carpeta?

translation.en: "Don't know family medical history"?
She has to ask. She's not judging you, baby.
translation.es: Debe preguntar. No te está juzgando.

translation.en: So what if I don't know if my family has high blood pressure or diabetes,
translation.es: ¿Y qué si no sé si mi familia tiene presión alta o diabetes,

translation.en: or the gene that gives you the little webby thing between your toes
translation.es: o ese gen que te da los pies raros

translation.en: that makes it impossible to wear flip-flops?
Listen, black people don't even wear flip-flops.
translation.es: Los negros ni siquiera usan sandalias.

translation.en: You're right, baby, we don't.
Makes our heel hard and our baby toe ashy.
translation.es: Hacen que el talón se endurezca y la piel se seque.

translation.en: You know, and I've tried every DNA website there is.
translation.es: Busqué en las páginas de ADN,

translation.en: I mean, all I found out was I may be related to Cleopatra...
translation.es: pero solo encontré que quizá sea descendiente de Cleopatra

translation.en: and I'm 1/23 Irish.
translation.es: y que soy un veintitresavo irlandés.

translation.en: Alan, my father is a federal circuit judge.
translation.es: Mi padre es juez del circuito federal.

translation.en: I've told you this a million times.
translation.es: Ya te lo dije un millón de veces.

translation.en: He'd be happy to help you find your family.
No. No, Marie.
That man don't like me.
He stopped liking you after you started liking me.
translation.es: No le agrado desde que yo te agrado.

translation.en: I don't wanna owe that man anything.
Look, Alan.
If this is as important to you as you say it is,
translation.es: Si esto es tan importante para ti como dices,

translation.en: now is the perfect time to ask.
[Alan] Who has a Sunday brunch on a Saturday?
Not even white folks do that.
[Marie] My mom insisted.
[Alan] Aw, I love your mommy.
Only thing I don't like about your mommy is your daddy.
translation.es: Lo único que no me gusta de tu mamá es tu papá.

translation.en: Surprise!
Mommy!
-Oh, my little Pooh Bear! -Oh!
Never surprise a pregnant lady. Don't y'all know that?
-Yeah, my water almost broke. -[Janet] Marie.
The whole family is here for you.
Really?
Your sisters, every aunt, uncle, cousin!
-Cousins, cousins, cousins. -Oh, Mom.
-This is like a Tyler Perry movie in here. -Oh, stop it.
translation.es: Es como una película de Tyler Perry.

translation.en: [Alan] So, Doug, your date, she seems really, um...
-outgoing. -Oh, yeah.
-She's a Russian aerial dancer. -[Alan] Okay.
-You know, like with ribbons? -Yeah, yeah.
That, or she's a spy.
Or maybe she's just a thief. I'm not sure.
translation.es: O tal vez sea una ladrona. No estoy seguro.

translation.en: But I'm keeping my sensitive documents in a safe just in case.
translation.es: Guardo mis cosas en una caja fuerte, por si acaso.

translation.en: Smart man.
-Doug. -Marie.
Oh, thank you so much for coming!
Oh, such a great shower!
-And these mommy-mosas are on fleek. -[Marie] Right?
translation.es: Y estas mimosas tienen mucha onda.

translation.en: -We don't say that. -Mm-mm.
Uh, off the chain.
-That's old. -No.
-They're the bomb. -[Alan and Marie] Stop.
Uh, shit, she's stealing.
-[Marie] What? -Excuse me.
-[speaking Russian] Nyet, nyet, nyet. -Da.
So...
Dad's at the grill,
so now's the perfect chance to talk to him.
translation.es: es la oportunidad perfecta para hablarle.

translation.en: -Hey. -Hmm?
-Dad, I was... -Ooh.
Sorry. Judge...
-Mm-hmm. -[Alan] Sir.
I got something I wanted to talk to you about.
You know, I wasn't exactly in favor
of you marrying my daughter.
translation.es: de que te casaras con mi hija.

translation.en: You kind of mentioned that during the wedding,
translation.es: Sí, lo mencionó durante la boda,

translation.en: when the preacher said, "Speak now or forever hold your peace."
translation.es: cuando el cura dijo: "Habla ahora o calla para siempre".

translation.en: You... you didn't hold your peace.
Alan, I'm trying to make sure that you understand that you're...
translation.es: Alan, intento asegurarme de que entiendas

translation.en: you're about to become the father of my grandchild.
translation.es: que serás el padre de mi nieto.

translation.en: I know this. And that-- that-- Sir.
[stammering] I leased a brand new SUV.
It's red, so everybody knows it's coming.
translation.es: Es rojo, así todos lo ven.

translation.en: Got the little "Baby On Board" sticker in the back,
and I'm almost finished with the nursery.
translation.es: Y ya casi termino con su habitación.

translation.en: I got a few finishing touches to put on, but--
-[sizzling] -[Leland] Damn it.
That's not what I'm talking about.
Son...
I want to share something with you.
Family is everything.
You don't have a family.
Now, Marie brings generations of success to the table.
translation.es: Marie trae generaciones de éxitos a la mesa.

translation.en: What exactly are you bringing?
I can throw with both arms.
-You can throw with both arms? -Mm-hmm.
Listen, sir.
I want to find my birth family.
But see, I need a court order
to unseal my adoption records.
translation.es: para acceder a mis registros de adopción.

translation.en: -Well, just so I'm clear... -Yes.
-So I'm clear... -Mm-hmm.
You're asking me for a favor?
Not a favor. Like a... "Favor" is a big word.
translation.es: No es un favor. Eso es una palabra grande.

translation.en: Like... adjust it. A "solid".
No, no. I wanna hear "favor." "Solid" doesn't work here.
Can we not say "favor" so hard?
"Judge, could you do me a favor?" Can you say something like that?
Can you do me a f--
Can you do me a favor?
There you go.
There you go. That wasn't that hard, was it?
-It was. -It was actually easier
than I thought it was going to be.
translation.es: Fue más fácil de lo que pensé.

translation.en: You...You know, you...
You're not much of a fighter, are you, son?
-Hmm? -No.
[Marie chuckles] What is this?
Aw! How cute is this?
Alan, look.
You know, I've been trying to get that information for years,
translation.es: Llevo años intentando obtener esa información,

translation.en: and your father got it in less than an hour.
translation.es: y tu padre la obtuvo en menos de una hora.

translation.en: Open it.
Marie, now... Now, once I open this, y-y-you know there's no going back.
translation.es: Una vez que abramos esto, no podemos volver atrás.

translation.en: Open the damn thing!
Um, Marie...
my whole life I always wondered what my birth family was like.
translation.es: siempre me pregunté cómo era mi familia biológica.

translation.en: Where'd they come from? Were they poor? And... And they worked hard,
translation.es: ¿De dónde vinieron? Si eran pobres y trabajadores,

translation.en: and then they started a successful dry cleaning company,
translation.es: y comenzaron una empresa de tintorería,

translation.en: [stammers] and then they got rich,
and they moved across town to the East side,
translation.es: y se mudaron al lado este,

translation.en: and then they bought a deluxe apartment--
translation.es: y compraron un apartamento de lujo...

translation.en: That's The Jeffersons.
I know, but a boy could dream.
translation.es: Lo sé, pero es mi sueño.

translation.en: -Just open the dag-gone thing! -Okay! Don't yell at me.
[Marie] God! Just avoiding it.
Baby, this is just stuff. I can't... I can't make nothin' of this.
translation.es: Estas son solo cosas, no entiendo nada.

translation.en: Okay, okay, all right. Records of Transfer...
Oh, my gosh, Alan. It's your birth certificate.
translation.es: Dios mío, Alan. Es tu partida de nacimiento.

translation.en: Look.
-[Alan] Oh, sh... Marie. -[Marie chuckles]
It's my birth certificate. [stammers] This is me!
Yep, all five pounds and six ounces of you.
-Hey! That's a healthy baby! -That's a good baby.
-Yeah. -Yeah.
-A little slim. -Little slim.
Oh. No father on record.
Oh! Alan, look.
Your birth mother's name is right here.
translation.es: El nombre de tu madre biológica está aquí.

translation.en: Lynette?
Wow! You know any Lynettes?
Uh, no.
I know a Lynette. My barber, the one that cuts my hair?
translation.es: Yo sí. La que me corta el pelo

translation.en: -Uh-huh. -She's a Lynette!
She faded it a little high, but I think she was high when she faded it.
translation.es: No me lo cortó bien, pero estaba drogada.

translation.en: -She did good. -Maybe my mom owns a salon!
translation.es: - Lo hizo bien. - Quizá mi mamá sea peluquera.

translation.en: Maybe she invented the weave.
And you're wearin' a weave right now, and that's why I was attracted to you,
translation.es: Y tú usas extensiones, por eso me gustas.

translation.en: 'cause you remind me of the weave that my mama created!
translation.es: Me recuerdas a lo que inventó mi mamá.

translation.en: [gasps] Oh, my God, maybe my mother's a millionaire!
Well, maybe you could ask her yourself.
Her address is right here.
-My-- -Look at this.
-I got a mommy. -You got a mama, baby.
-I got a mama. -Baby.
-I got a mama. -Baby.
-Hey. -[Marie laughs]
-You got a grand-mommy! -You've got a grandma!
-But what if she doesn't wanna meet me? -How can she not wanna meet you?
translation.es: ¿Y si no quiere conocerme? ¿Por qué no querría conocerte?

translation.en: Now, listen, you better hurry up, or you'll miss your chance.
'Cause in a couple of weeks, you're gonna have to focus
translation.es: En dos semanas, deberás concentrarte en esta familia.

translation.en: on the family you have right here.
-Okay. -Okay?
Thank you.
Don't worry. I'll be back.
-Okay. -[engine turns over]
Probably in a helicopter, because, you know, my mama is ballin'!
translation.es: Probablemente en un helicóptero, porque mi mamá es rica.

translation.en: Love you! A lot!
Bye, baby! And other baby!
♪ So, whatever ♪
What do I call her?
Hey...
Mom!
I... I forgive you, Mom.
Yeah, I'm not even a little bitter that you wasn't around
translation.es: Sí, me molesta que no hayas estado

translation.en: for the last 38 years, you frickin' bitch!
translation.es: en los últimos 38 años, maldita perra.

translation.en: I'm sorry.
It's gonna be cool. It's gonna be good. Mm-hmm.
[man] Just leave the mail on the porch!
translation.es: Deja el correo en el porche.

translation.en: Oh, hey!
[man] You're not our usual mailman.
translation.es: No eres el cartero de siempre.

translation.en: No, I'm-- I'm not with the Postal Service.
Sir, I am anxiously awaiting an episode of Mork & Mindy.
translation.es: Señor, estoy ansiosamente esperando un episodio de Mork & Mindy.

translation.en: So, you leave me no choice to be somewhat rude
translation.es: No tengo otra opción más que ser grosero

translation.en: and say, "Please, go away!"
Who watches Mork & Mindy still?
[knocking] Sir!
Does Lynette Spellman live here?
No. And I'll say it in Spanish,
translation.es: No. Y lo diré en italiano:

translation.en: "El no."
Then, why is "L. Spellman" on the mailbox?
translation.es: ¿Por qué dice "L. Spellman" en el buzón?

translation.en: Very well.
But she's not here.
Really? Damn it.
What do you want?
My name is Alan,
and Lynette Spellman is my mother.
Lynette Spellman only has one son, and his name is Russell.
translation.es: Lynette Spellman tiene solo un hijo y se llama Russell.

translation.en: Right. I have proof.
What in the quantum leap?
Give me that.
This can't be.
I'm her son!
This... This is a mistake!
Wait, you're her son?
I'm her son. That means we're brothers!
translation.es: Yo soy su hijo. Significa que somos hermanos.

translation.en: Wait. You're my brother, Russell!
No, no, no, no. No, no. Look, right there. You see that? See that?
See that misprint? See that date there, that's my birthday.
translation.es: ¿Ves esa errata? La fecha ahí es mi cumpleaños.

translation.en: -And, see-- -Yeah, but that's my birthday.
Yeah, but that would only make sense if, in fact,
you and I were... [chuckles]
Twins.
We're twins.
Russell!
We're twins!
Come here, bro!
This is awkward.
I've never had a man hug me before.
If you don't release me, I'm gonna be forced to use my warning whistle
translation.es: Si no me sueltas, me veré obligado a usar el silbato de emergencias.

translation.en: Mother gave me.
translation.es: a usar el silbato de emergencias.

translation.en: Okay, I warned you.
-[whistles] -All right, shh, shh! Hey!
-Stranger danger! Stranger danger! -[dogs barking]
Can we... Can we go inside?
Don't touch anything with your measly hands.
translation.es: No toques nada con tus manos sucias.

translation.en: Everything here is very valuable.
These are antiques, especially the TV Guide,
translation.es: Son antigüedades, especialmente la guía de la TV.

translation.en: so it's gonna be worth billions one day.
Well, here's some more news.
-You're about to be an uncle. -Phooey.
-Uncle Russell. -That's a terrible name.
translation.es: - El tío Russell. - Que feo nombre.

translation.en: -Has a little ring to it. -Sounds like a cheesy morning disc jockey.
translation.es: No suena nada mal. Parece un disc-jockey cursi.

translation.en: This is the family home, huh?
Yeah. Jealous? [chuckles]
I still can't believe
that I'm standing here with my very own twin.
translation.es: Todavía no puedo creer que seamos gemelos.

translation.en: [Russell] Me neither.
I mean, look at us.
We look exactly alike.
Yeah, we... We look almost...
exactly... nothing alike.
No, we look exactly, exactly alike.
It's like I'm looking at myself in the mirror.
translation.es: Me estoy viendo en un espejo.

translation.en: It's uncanny!
Same face, same hairline.
Well, I'm a lot more handsome.
That's why I got the beauty marks and you don't. [chuckles]
translation.es: Por eso tengo lunares y tú no.

translation.en: So, Russell, I...
take it you still live here.
[scoffs] That's a rather obvious observation.
translation.es: ...asumo que sigues viviendo aquí. Es una observación obvia.

translation.en: Why else would I have my very own cereal bowl
translation.es: ¿Por qué si no tendría mi propio tazón

translation.en: with my name written on it?
-See? -Yeah.
It's so good. I love cereal. [slurps]
translation.es: Qué rico. Me encantan los cereales.

translation.en: Well, that's something me and you have in common.
translation.es: Es algo que tenemos en común.

translation.en: I like cereal, too.
I'm more of a Wheat Chex guy myself.
translation.es: Me gustan más los Wheat Chex.

translation.en: Wheat Chex?
I'm sorry, Alan. I like my cereals to be edible.
translation.es: Lo siento. A mí me gustan los cereales comibles.

translation.en: Preferably with the fruit-forward complexities
translation.es: Preferentemente con frutas y llamados Captain's Crunchberries.

translation.en: of the Captain's Crunchberries.
So, when do I see her?
-Who? -[Alan] Mom.
I-I mean, Lynette.
When does she get back?
Uh... that's... that's rather hard to say.
Oh, I got so much stuff to ask her.
I mean, so many things I wanna tell her, like I'm married,
translation.es: Quiero contarle muchas cosas. Que estoy casado y que será abuela.

translation.en: she's gonna be a grandma.
translation.es: Que estoy casado y que será abuela.

translation.en: Uh, she's dead!
You said what?
Yeah, you know...
I regret to inform you...
Lynette Spellman has passed on.
How?
Car accident.
I told her she should check her brakes.
translation.es: Le dije que revisara los frenos.

translation.en: So she got up under that 1986 Honda Civic SE.
translation.es: Era un Honda Civic SE de 1986.

translation.en: It was blue.
Periwinkle, to be exact.
She was just that type of gal,
real hands-on and cheap as the day is long.
Obviously, I couldn't do it for her.
translation.es: Yo no podía revisarlos por ella.

translation.en: Because of your size?
Because I know nothing about fancy, expensive, foreign cars like Hondas.
translation.es: Porque no sé nada de autos extranjeros, sofisticados y caros como un Honda.

translation.en: So-- So, she was crushed?
I'm afraid so.
Oh, wow.
Oh, this is just so devastating. Just--
Uh, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Come on.
-Oh, I'm-- I'm sorry. -That's my seat.
translation.es: - Lo siento. - Esa es mi silla.

translation.en: Sorry, Alan. I've spent a lot of time
making this leather conform to only my buttocks.
translation.es: para que el cuero se ajustara solo a mis nalgas.

translation.en: Can't believe I finally find her and now it's too late.
translation.es: Finalmente la encontré y es demasiado tarde.

translation.en: Maybe you should just go home and mourn.
translation.es: Deberías ir a tu casa a llorar.

translation.en: Now, excuse me. My television show is on. Thank you.
Do you have any pictures?
I hate havin' a brother already!
Don't touch my cereal.
I lived my entire life with that woman, and although buck-toothed,
translation.es: Viví toda mi vida con ella, y aunque tenía dientes salidos,

translation.en: she was a saint.
And what about Dad?
Deserted her the instant she got pregnant.
But she carried on.
Seems like an amazing woman.
Indeed.
Sour ball?
Sure.
She never said anything about why she gave me up?
Never mentioned you.
Not a word. [chews]
Not a peep. [chuckles]
Oh, so sour.
[Russell] Seriously?
Did you just bite into a sour ball?
